basics.name: Samantha Limon
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

courses: ICS 111: Introduction to Computer Science I (Object-Oriented Programming)
ICS 211: Introduction to Computer Science II (Data Structures)
ICS 141: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science I
ICS 241: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science II

highlights: Pick up and distribute mail, forward mail to proper personnel
File materials as instructed by supervisor
Answer phone and assist with inquiries
Develop a prototype toolkit and GUI for the next generation DKIST Daily Activity Report Form
Determine whether native or web-based applications would be best for improving the UI to log day time activity and operations

work.company: Instructional Design and Educational Assessment Lab
highlights: Work on student-led computer science research funded by UROP
Attend weekly meetings with principal investigator and other IDEA lab student researchers

volunteer.organization: Native Hawaiian Science and Engineering Mentorship Program
highlights: Engage in community service for Hawaiian communities
Participate in developmental workshops and network with faculty/staff in the STEM workforce
Solve algorithmic programming problems in preparation for technical job interviews
Attend events aimed to help students develop computer science skills through mock interviews, resume building, and career information sessions
Worked with students in an in-class recitation section for ICS 111: Introduction to Computer Science
Held office hours every week to assist students with course content
Taught a lesson covering Number Theory and Cryptography
Plan and organize community service events for over 60 club members, including volunteer activities and donation drives
Communicate with respective outside sources and club members through regular meetings, email, and social media

awards.title: Douglas S. Yamamura Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to applicant(s) of the highest-regarded UROP project proposal during each funding cycle to support undergraduate research and creative work at UH Mānoa.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade.

awards.title: State of Hawai’i B Plus Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to undergraduate students who graduated from a State of Hawai’i public high school and ompleted a rigorous high school curriculum.

awards.title: Sakada Scholar
awards.awarder: The United Filipino Council of Hawaii Foundation
awards.summary: Awarded to outstanding high school seniors who believe in the importance of education and community service as future leaders in our community and the community at large, to pursue their academic realities.

awards.title: Harriet and Kwai Yeu Choy STEM/Education Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to students who have demonstrated strong academic records, work ethics, and giving back to the greater community.
